title: Reverse dependency handling in task splitting
description: When splitting tasks, reverse dependencies are not updated. Tasks that depend on the original should depend on the final split part, but currently still point to non-existent original task ID. Critical dependency integrity issue.

title: EisenhowerMatrix component too large (1500+ lines)
description: Component needs separation into EisenhowerGrid.tsx (grid view), EisenhowerScatter.tsx (scatter plot + diagonal scan), and EisenhowerMatrix.tsx (container + view switching). Single responsibility principle violated.

title: Extract BaseSplitModal for shared logic
description: Split modals share significant slider logic, duration calculations, and UI patterns. Could extract common functionality into parent component to reduce duplication.

title: Time logging export for development dogfooding
description: Need ability to export time spent on workflows/tasks to better track development time. Should show breakdown by phase/component for project estimation improvements.

title: When attempting to log time on a workflow, the step should be specified
description: we should try to avoid logging time on the workflow itself, and always do it on steps.

title: 'Time sinks' Functionality
description: I want to add a feature for 'Time sinks', which are tasks that never get completed but still take up time. User story: I, as a user, am trying to track my day. I realized I have spent the last hour talking on the phone with a friend, just chatting, accomplishing no real goal. I want to setup a time sink in the app called 'phone time with friends' so that I can log time on it. Over time, I can see how much time I've spent on each 'Time sink' over the course of different time periods so I can analyze how I spend my time. This should go hand in hand with the other feature request about doing the planned vs actual day

title: UI improvements
description: the timeline has scrollbars for vertical and horizontal, but I don't like scroll bars. It should be more like a canvas with infinite scroll (doesn't actually need to be infinite). Also, we can drag and drop blocks on the clock, but not on the timeline view. The clock has overlapping labels that make it hard to tell the time. When there are too many workflows and personal tasks, the timeline becomes way too crowded. No amount of vertical shrinking can fix it. So we should probably only show tasks that we have actually worked on, and have an option to add a row for a task. And we should make sure the hiding of completed tasks works, and also works for workflow steps (very important). Additionally, we should definitely be able to fullscreen this, and the timeline view should probably take up more space. There's a lot of empty space below the chart (the clock doesn't take up that much horizontal space) so we could probably include a print out of all the work blocks done for the day. I was also thinking we could use the scheduler's output to show 'planned work' with some kind of indicator that it hasn't actually been logged yet. and then the user can verify the time they've spent so far in the day and what their day looks like for the rest of it.

title: Add some way to show circadian rhythm
description:
some cool UI showing a bezier curve or something else with control points to illustrate cognitive peaks and dips. 

UPDATE Sep 02 10:40 PM: I still can't see the curve aspect on the dual view logger. Is it somewhere else? Also, it seems it STILL doesn't update when user changes their sleep or wake time. Unless it requires a restart or something

title: Hide pattern in log view not working
description: Hiding patterns of log spam messages is only sort of working. Seems like its mostly working but a UI issue is still showing all of them but with an eye icon instead of a void sign. There are other signs of the UI updating, like "Hiding pattern ..." but the amount of actual displayed is still the same. Also, the logging around the logging view (haha) needs more attention. Like if we're hiding and showing things the ui and the core logic need to both be logging

title: Add license to repo
description: The license should be some sort of open source thing, but the main thing is I want to ensure I have intellectual property of the codebase and that even if others use it or run it, they can't make money off it.

title: Load last used session by default
description: When I open the app, instead of loading my last session, it always loads the default session

title: Render scatter plot, rather than 4 quadrant buckets
description: I would like to render a scatter plot, where one axis it urgency and the other is importance. Something with (10,10) would be top right, something (0,0) would be bottom left. This will allow relative comparison of priority within each quadrant. Then we should do a diagonal scanline going from top right to bottom left (I guess it would be hypotenuse length or euclidean distance) to determine the eisenhower sequence of when to do tasks. Each dot on the scatter plot should be hoverable and have a tool tip, and be color coded somehow

title: Add filter by task type
description: Specifically want to filter out or in personal tasks. When there are too many tasks, it becomes too hard to find by scrolling. Alternatively, we can implement a grid or row like view with filterable columns. Maybe we should do both.

title: Applicator makes duplicate tasks, and amendment edit form is missing fields
description: When edited results are accepted, duplicate steps are added to the workflow. Additionally, we should be able to not only specify dependencies, but what tasks depend on the new task, so both way wiring of dependencies.

title: Time tracking does not save notes.
description: I've been using time tracking and writing notes as I complete workflow steps. But now when I look at the workflow steps, I don't see any of my notes! where did they go, were they ever saved?
steps:
1. log time on a workflow step
2. write a note in the textbox
3. click save and complete step
4. go to workflow step view (edit mode)
5. observe no notes were saved.

title: Should be able to press a button and see all notes for all workflow steps in sequence
description: User story: I've been logging work and tracking everything as I go, including writing notes. But now I can't remember which steps I put the notes on, and I don't want to click through all of them. I want to press a button and see a print out of all the notes I've ever put on any part of this workflow.

title: When a workflow is started or stopped work sessions and progress tracking should be recorded/updated
description: I as a user start my day by brainstorming tasks. Then I go to my workflow page and I hit start workflow. I come back after a while and then I hit pause. I expect to see tracked work here on the task that I was working on in the workflow, and I also expect the work status/daily capacity module on the sidebar to update. I should also see the new work session with time logged on the dual view work, editor.
steps: Create a workflow with multiple tasks. Start one of the tasks. After sometime has apse press stop task observe that the elapsed completed time or track time on any of the modules does not update.
expected: Starting and stopping a workflow should track time similar to all of the other tracking and time logging modules. When work is completed in a pause from my workflow, I should see work logging and work sessions appear on all components
actual: Starting and stopping, the workflow does not cause any log work to appear

title: Use Notes applied to Tasks/Workflows/Workflow Steps for amendments
description: So the user story would be like this. As I'm working throughout the day, I complete tasks and use the progress tracking module in order to keep up with my work progress. Then, after a little bit of time, I decide I need to change some of the aspects of my workflow. But as I've been working, I've been adding notes to each step as I track my progress. Notes might include, "investigated this task and now I'm not sure if I need the follow up task ", or "through doing this task I've discovered that I need another task which is refactoring." I should be able to click a button that is modify workflows based on Notes or something similar and then go through the amendment application process, but using only the notes that I've applied to tasks and not any voice input.

title: After amendment is edited and accepted, it is duplicated
description: So basically, I'm still working with the errand workflow that's in the other feedback but I made an amendment that was like, "please add a step to this work from that is furniture research" and it presented the step and everythin, and everything looks good, but then when I click accept edited results, the the actual application seems to be buggy. For example, the new step that I was creating was created twice and the dependency wiring still seems to not work.
steps: I think that will reproduce it every time if we use the voice amendment to specify a new tasks with dependencies on task edit the option options and then click accept edited results

title: Steps do not inherit 'personal' from workflow
description: So basically, I have a session now for Sunday 831, and in this session I have two workflow one is like my actual work stuff which is like this is server you can see this in the database using our scripts to debug or print output from the database. The other task that I have is like a personal workflow so like it's getting errands it's driving to get coffee first and then doing research for furniture options and then picking up AC units and going home once again you should be able to see this in database using the scripts. Basically, I can set the workflow itself to personal as a task type, but then all of the workflow steps have to be either focus or admin so if I change a workflow to personal, then I can never actually schedule any of the steps because all of the steps are either focus or admin, and they won't get slotted into the personal block.
context: I'm very concerned that we are not using our enums correctly throughout the application. I am very concerned that you are using strings repeatedly, even though all of the best practices say that we should be using enums.
steps: Create a workflow with multiple steps and set a workflow type to personal, then go to the menu and click on a step and then try I need to change the step and observe that only focus and admin exist
expected: Workflow should be able to work with personal time box just the same as task and so I'm honestly very confused why it's even possible that the workflow step dropped down only has focused and admin types because we should be doing a drop-down based on the enum and so how is this possible at all? The expected behavior is that for any task or any work. Or anything in the application at all that can have a type the type should be selectable as either one of focus, admin or personal, and that is just true, no matter what
actual: The app is saying that I cannot select personal time for a worthless step, but I can select personal time for the workflow which puts it in a state where it cannot be scheduled

title: UI doesn't update after clarification
description:
Basically, during a user test, it came up that the UI around the giving clarification to the AI brainstorm model is like pretty buggy so I'm gonna attach like basically the print out of everything that was on the page and then the different text boxes of clarification that the user provided but a few things about this so first we don't allow them to do a voice recording here but they can do a voice recording basically every route so it feels a little inconsistent. And then it's weird how there's like a regenerate with clarification button on each text box. There should really only be one at the bottom. It doesn't make sense for it to do text box but then also when you click the like one of them if you know you get that first spinning model again and it looks like everything is going, but didn't eventually the spinning stops but it's really hard to tell if you're clarification was even provided early like given saved whatever doesn't appear that the clarification is used to change anything about the steps, which is interesting cause you know the AI directly asked for the clarification. So we need to like update and then you know show what's different and then remove the filled out clarification boxes, and then like new clear clarification should be filled out in the forms if possible, or if required by the AI if there are any more clarification.

clarifications provided by user: 

I think I would like to declutter as I go with a separate task or time set aside for big pushes of decluttering that may be happens at the beginning of a cleaning session or something like that because I'd by the end I'll have decision fatigue and I'll just not be able to let go of as many items possibly and I'll probably donate the items to be honest. I'm likely I'm less likely to sell them and so that's a pretty quick process I can take them. It'll take me like five minutes to walk them 5 to 10 minutes to walk them over to a thrift store and the Decluttered items should really get out of here as soon as possible. I want them gone. I don't know what they are yet but when I see them, I don't ever wanna see them again after that.

Target date for the party is September 6. Taskrabbit can usually be booked day of or like one day in advance and specifically we need removal of pretty big items like the couch the beanbag a bunch of cardboard and we might need to get task to handle the disposal, they can move large items and trash and junk large items too.

Friend availability is probably pretty wide open and I prefer to donate or do like some sort of an easy yard sale, but this is like a low priority to get it sold at the end of the day. I just want the items out and it's more important to be setting up for a party and to get my other things in order so like keep any selling or up cycling at low priority

title: Better UI presentation on Ai brainstorm modal
description: During a user test, a user was very confused with the AI brainstorm model so basically there's not a clear delineation between the job context section and then the actual brainstorming section and the user was unclear about what to say in the context especially for nontraditional jobs or non-computer science jobs let's say and I think in general, we need to make this more friendly towards people who don't work in a very specific software engineering job but also there should be a way to like a UI button to get rid of the context cause you can delete it from the text box but then it still shows up that it's using like the recording. It shows that like M4a or webm file so we need to basically clear the UI completely to signal the user that the job context is actually gone.

title: Add ability for AI-brainstorm to incorporate relevant task info from web search
description: Web search feature should be added to the AI component so that tasks with unseen contingencies can be cross-referenced with available information online such as I need to buy tickets to this music festival, but I don't remember when it is saying something like that the AI should be able to say when it is for you and help incorporate that deadline into your workflow planning

title: Scheduling debug view not visible
description: During my use of the application, I eventually arrived at the Gantt chart where i noticed that no matter what I did, clicking on the debug scheduling info did nothing. Maybe this regression came from the scheduling engine major refactor we did.
expected: We should see the debug scheduling view when this is clicked, even if it just shows that there were no scheduling issues. It should also always print out the cognitive complexity, priority, async boost, and other weighting components in the scheduling algorithm. We had this feature not too long ago, maybe one or two PRs, so we lost this somehow and need to get it back.

title: Logging of schedule output and debug info in AI readable way
description: We should make some logging feature (also we should add the logging module as a component on the feedback form) that allows for the schedule, calendar, gantt chart, etc. to be exported and logged in a way that Claude Code can easily access it. This will encourage less copy and pasting from the user, and allow more transparency into the current issues and debugging of the application. Right now, I have to describe what I see on the gantt chart, but this should be logged so that if there's an error, the AI can view it in text format directly,

title: Schedule generate button has bug that prevents UI from moving forward
steps: Make sleep blocks, set to daily. Click generate schedule. Observe error.

title: Sleep block only rendered until midnight
description: sleep block rendering chops off at midnight despite being scheduled until the next morning. This appears to be just a UI bug.

title: Flexible blocks created by the schedule generator are broken on day 1.
description:
A flexible block was generated, but nothing was being scheduled. I found that I could edit the block and switch to focused, and then back to flexible, and it worked. 

we need way better logging on the schedule generation. I checked the log dump in the dev tools custom panel and didn't see anything despite these issues.

title: Generation of schedule deletes sleep blocks
description: I created sleep blocks that were daily, then generated a schedule. After refreshing, the sleep blocks are gone on the calendar view.

But right now, if I do that, it does a bunch of weird shit, like saying it's marking the entire workflow as complete 6 times, introducing duplicate tasks, not wiring dependencies correctly (orphan nodes in graph view) and generally just not being able to apply ammendments, despite thinking it has 95%+ confidence. This whole thing needs a review. Here's a snapshot of the application: Work Capacity Planner

UPDATE 8/28 Noon PDT: there are still a bunch of sessions that say "default session" and I can't delete them. UI will show 'successfully deleted' but they are not deleted even after a page reload. 

Let's also edit the logging so something is logged here. Just checked the log dump and saw nothing, which is problematic given that the logs are supposed to be granular and detailed and surface things like this.

title: Task splitting appears to try to schedule multiple chunks of the same task concurrently
description: Multiple tasks with the same name (test task 1 (1/3), test task 1 (2/3), ...) I think this is from task splitting, but we are scheduling them overlapping and also at the same time. We should probably have a validation that runs at the end of the timeline generation that catches these easy things and alerts the user or errors.

title: Clock labels are buggy and control nodes are rendered in bad position
description: control nodes for the time segment of the logged work render away from the actual arc around the clock, and the labels for the hours are weird. Prefer a clock with 2 rings or 2 separate clocks, since the unified 24 hour one seems buggy

title: Scheduling engine appears to prioritize task switching for no reason
description: My highest priority task has several components (but the first step doesn't have any async wait, while the next one does) but the steps are not scheduled in sequence, and instead are broken up by another, lower priority task. But we should definitely prioritize getting to that workflow step that has async time, since that should be the goal of the scheduler.

title: Workflow step scheduled during meeting
description: Added a meeting called test meeting, and noticed a workflow step is scheduled at that time. This is in the User Test session, and should be in the database

title: When trying to manually add a workflow by typing (not AI brainstorm), the workflow gets duped
description: After trying to fill out a workflow by hand, I clicked save. I used a workflow with 2 tasks (btw maybe need to update all user test plan items with specific strings like "create workflow ith 2 tasks with values blank and blank" or something so it's easier for you to debug) and when I clicked save, I now see 2 workflows, each with the same name and each with one task. Also, I had to refresh in order to get to it. Also, the other fields like deadline and complexity are not available in this menu. We probably need a workflow editing/creation UI unification - things are getting out of sync
steps: Manually make a workflow with 2 tasks and hit save. Observe two workflows pop up
expected: Users should be able to sequence tasks and create a workflow with multiple steps, without duplication.
actual: Workflow is broken into two workflows, each with one of the steps. Dependencies are broken. Editing UI is bad.

title: Clarifications still buggy
description:
If the AI is confused, it should ask questions the user can answer, and then we should be able to regenerate, based on the clarifications provided for each workflow task or step. But right now, all I see is quick edits to change priority or duration. The quick edits don't even have all the other edit options, like cognitive complexity or deadlines, and i cant change values for individual workflow tasks

UPDATE: 8/27 12:32 PM PDT: Still not seeing a way to provide clarifications. In fact, it seems worse now than before. Only an option to accept or try again. Here's what I see: Summary:
Code submission workflow involving unit tests, a long-running supercomputer simulation (2-3 hours), code review with a day-long wait, and finalization. The 30-minute wait mentioned conflicts with the 2-3 hour workflow duration from context, requiring clarification.
Async Workflows (1):
Code Submission and Review Workflow
Focused
4 steps
Complete workflow from writing unit tests through final code approval, including running supercomputer simulation and review process
Active Work: 1715min
Earliest: 2.1 hours active work + 26.5 hours wait = 28.6 hours total
Worst Case: Including potential simulation retries and review iterations: 72-96 hours
Workflow Steps:
1. Write unit tests
60min
2. Run supercomputer simulation workflow
15min
+150min wait

3. Submit code for review
20min

30min

Notes: CLARIFICATION NEEDED: The brainstorm mentions 'wait like 30 minutes' after running the workflow, but job context states workflows take '2-3 hours'. Which is correct? Assumed 2.5 hours for simulation based on job context. Review wait time of 'like a day' interpreted as ~24 hours. Need to clarify: 1) Exact simulation duration, 2) Whether unit tests must pass before running workflow, 3) What 'finalize' entails - merge to main? deployment? 4) Typical review turnaround time more precisely
steps: Use this prompt from user test: I need to complete a code review that will take 2 hours, write documentation for 90 minutes, attend a team meeting for 1 hour, and fix three bugs which should take 30 minutes each and observe lack of good clarification or quick edit options after AI is done generating
expected: User should be able to answer the questions with voice or text directly, and the quick edit options should contain all editable fields, per workflow step (obviously, they should inherit if left blank)
actual: Only a few edit options are shown, and there is no place to supply clarifications to AI questions.

title: Schedule doesn't support multi day generation
description: Used this from User test script: I work 9 to 5 on weekdays with a lunch break from 12 to 1. I have focus time in the morning from 9 to 12 and admin time in the afternoon from 1 to 5. On weekends I want personal time from 10am to 2pm. And weekend days were not generated. In fact, only one day is generated
steps: use the voice script from the user test or description, note that only one day (and no weekend days) are generated.
expected: Users should be able to specify multiple days and have the AI assistant build a schedule that spans multiple days.
actual: Only one day is generated, weekends are discarded. Additionally, there is no way to copy a schedule from a weekend day to another weekend day.

title: Need better UI refresh
description: In many cases, like starting a new session, logging work, or other uses, the user changes the data of the application and the UI needs a manual refresh in order for the User to see it.
steps: Make a schedule in one session, then start a new session. You should see the sidebar on the left still show you the scheduled time for the old sessoin.
expected: All UI should refresh if necessary whenever any data it uses changes.

title: test
description: test test

title: Two edit buttons to access task edit page
description: in order to edit a task, one must first select the little pencil icon, and THEN click edit. We should automatically be brought to the edit page when we click the icon.

title: Eisenhower matrix duplicates
description: see this in terminal: EisenhowerMatrix.tsx:158 Encountered two children with the same key, `bee6c880-c5ea-4856-a591-7ed07c1f2ff4`. Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be duplicated and/or omitted ‚Äî the behavior is unsupported and could change in a future version. and duplicates on the UI. Also, we should add the eisenhower matrix as an affected component on the feedback form

title: Changing the cognitive complexity doesn't persist
description: If I edit a task to have a different cognitive complexity and save, and then I try to click on another page and go back, it resets to the previous complexity value

title: No way to remove a deadline
description: If a delete the deadline and resave, nothing happens. I can reload or click off the screen and come back and the deadline is still there

title: Time picker in task edit form should use clock widget
description: All time selectors throughout the app should use the same clock widget.

title: No way to make deadline for workflow
description: I don't see an option in the UI to set the deadline for a workflow

title: Editing Cognitive Complexity shows nothing on task view
description: after changing a task's cognitive complexity, I would imagine the task list view should update to show the new complexity, but it doesn't. In fact, complexity is missing entirely from some tasks' display card, but exists on others.

title: Add split button to split task into two parallel or sequential task with same dependencies
description: Sometimes, a user may encounter a task that actually needs to be split into several steps. Rather than marking complete the old step and creating two new ones, we should introduce a 'split' functionality that allows a task to split into two subtasks while preserving the dependency relation. We should have options for splitting in sequence (one subtask depends on the other) and splitting in parallel (subtasks can be done in any order)

title: Real time vs Optimal time comparison view
description: I want to be able to start my day and 'freeze' the schedule, so that throughout the day we can see how we are spending our time compared to the plan. Ideally this would be two timeline views, one showing the planned day originally when the freeze happened, and the other showing the actual work logging. Then it could show me empty time, gaps, breaks that went too long, or bad estimates.

title: Clock should show hours before 6 am
description: I know we made the clock originally not show anything except 8-8, but I've been working starting earlier than that, and I think I want to see the full 24 hours on the clock

title: Show cognitive complexity in task list
description: cognitive complexity should be showed alongside the other task attributes.

title: Universal task field quick edit UI
description: We need a UI that allows me to cycle through tasks very quickly and correct them (adjust duration, priority, deadline, etc.) Basically I want it to be a single page with a tile, where the tile is the task, and then there are quick edit dropdowns or sliders, etc., that allow me to change all the fields easily without typing or anything like that. It's too time consuming to go through them all right now.

title: Allow periodic events in the scheduler
description: We should allow periodic events, like, "check slack" that are prioritized in the scheduler to occur multiple times throughout the day. I shouldn't have to make 2-3 tasks that are all the same. Instead, I want one task that i can specify 'pop up every 2 hours.' This should work for hours and days (like check something daily, hourly, weekly, etc. should all work). The total estimated duration for the task should be the number of repetitions times the estimated time of each repetition.

title: Personal blocks appear in the UI as 'mixed'
description: When creating a personal block on the schedule UI, the block shows us as 'mixed time' as if it is a combination of focus and admin instead of personal. I don't think this affects actual scheduling logic, just a UI bug.

title: On the calendar view, tasks are not sorted by time
description: So I'm actually not sure if this component that I selected in the feedback form is correct but on the navigation panel, there's an item for calendar and in the calendar view it's like a two column thing where one column is the calendar and then the second column to the right of it is like a printout of all of the work blocks and all the tasks for the day, but what I know is that sometimes when we make work blocks like in our schedule editor when we drag them around and stuff on the chart, it doesn't actually drag the ordering of them in the way that they're listed and this leads me to believe that when it's stored, it's stored as like an array of work blocks or something but it's not in chronological order. It's in creation order. So basically this propagates through to the calendar and then we display them in creation order rather than chronological order and it needs to be fixed.
steps: Create a work schedule with at least two blocks and then move the block you created second so that it comes before the first block even though it's timing comes afterward, then save the schedule and then go to the calendar view and then you should see the work block out of order printed in the second column of the calendar, layout

title: Time logged in the dual view work logger component not shown in workflow progress tracker

title: Should not have 2 edit buttons to edit a workflow
description: I have to click two edit buttons to actually get to a page to edit the workflows.

title: Better AI Brainstorm Editing and Feedback
description: Basically, I want the AI brainstorm to be more interactive like I noticed that the AI puts notes out where it says need more clarification on X. But from what I understand there's no way to actually give it more clarification except for canceling the entire brainstorming session and then restarting with the same prompt. I think there's like an option for like try again or something I have some of the same issues with the amendment applicator I think that the ideal workflow would be to see what the AI suggest and then have like a text box underneath it's "" notes so that a user can input notes immediately to answer the questions and then have Claude redo the workflow generation just for that one item and then another thing I noticed was I would really like to be able to edit priorities and durations on that same AI brainstorm menu before I click accept. And for the amendment applicator I think few things first is that I need to be able to like use the application and scroll through it in order to like check on the current state and scroll through current workflow so I can say OK this one needs to be changed. But the issue is that it tries to apply to like all of the workflow and then if it gets it wrong, it just says do you wanna try again and you have to like restart from scratch and it doesn't even really save your voice memo or allow you to text edit it basically this is supposed to be unease of use feature to make things easier and I feel like it actually makes things take a little bit longer would be more tedious sometimes. Additionally, I was thinking it would be nice if I could like open up an AI chat window and actually talk to Claude but kind of with the same framework where it has to output like workflows and and stuff and maybe we could integrate like a chat into like what is already existin and that way whatever Claude responds with it's like displayed as a workflow.

description: It's too far to the right, overlapping the first two blocks (column). Is this component even in the feedback affected components list?

description: I go to sleep at like 9 pm, so my circadian second peak is actually at 5 pm ish, where it says I will be at low energy right now! So we need to be able to specify the bedtime or at least read it from the sleep blocks or something.

title: Allow splitting of tasks to schedule tasks with long durations
description: If a task has like a 6 hour duration, but there are no 6 hour work blocks, I think it will never get scheduled.

title: The sidebar doesn't update after logging work
description: It requires a window reload in order to update. By side bar, I mean the WorkStatusWidget. It requires manual reload. I would change the component, but that's lacking in the edit capabilities of feedback right now

title: Option to hide completed tasks in the timeline view in the dual view work logger
description: It gets way too crowded in the work logger view and I need to be able to filter down tasks. We can start by adding a filter for completed tasks.
context: We should probably lay the groundwork for a full featured filtering system.

title: Personal Task not displayed
description:
I made a personal task called 'Task Management app' or something similar, and it is not displayed on the chart (it doesn't have a row)

UPDATE: I can't get this task to show up on the timeline or be scheduled no matter what. Even if I open up a 6hr personal block tomorrow, nothing. If I open a 6hr focus block tomorrow, nothing either. There's something very wrong here. We should limit our tasktype enums to only those that the scheduler can handle. I actually think we turned off a lint check for unused enum values, we should turn it back on.

title: Feedback View Feature Duplicates
description: Each feedback item has 3 entries instead of 1, when I try to select one of them, all 3 are selected. Also, we should add the ability to update the feedback text for incomplete tasks. I.e. a feedback item complains about 2 bugs: bug 1 and bug 2, i should be able to change the text so that it only references bug 2 if bug 1 has been fixed. This is easier than completing and making a new one. Also, the prioirty field on the feedback form, even though it is autofilled by default with medium, doesn't recognize that priority has been filled out until you click a priority radio button.

title: "Now" Marker on Timeline View
description: it would be helpful to have a marker for the current time on the dual view timeline view, similar to how we have it for the Gantt chart

title: Duplicated Row in Gantt Chart from Dual View Feature Work
description:
When we fixed the bug in the dual view, I think we introduced weird behavior in the Gantt Chart. Now there's a row for meetings, and a row for 'blocked time.' I actually kinda like this though, but the blocked time row should show everything from all rows merged into a single timeline. We still need the row for meetings. But I stored personal time slots like 'sleep' and 'breakfast' and 'exercise' as meetings so that might be why it's just a copy. 

This has been fixed-ish, but I said I wanted a row that showed everything. The implementation for this feedback just deleted the row entirely.

title: The intervals in the Gantt chart dual view overlap and truncate to an hour
description: The intervals in the Gantt chart dual view overlap and truncate to an hour. We also need to display some text for the meetings, and/or provide a tooltip. It's hard to verify it's correct because I can't see what meetings are taking up timeslots.
steps:
1. make meetings
2. click on work logger dual view icon
3. look at row called "meetings"
expected: Tooltip, not truncated to 1 hour intervals (show actual duration), and no overlap.

title: Time blocks overlap in the chart but not clock
description: In the clock, the arcs i see are aligned, but in the gantt chart style timeline view, they overlap

title: Need to see meetings on gantt chart view
description:
Must have meetings visually to fill out logged time. Should also probably display total meeting time on sidebar, which should probably be listed as a component on the feedback form as well, unless that's what daily schedule view is.

Mostly fixed, but we need to display total meeting time on the sidebar, like where I see the "Today's Planned Capacity" currently.

title: Work Pattern Repetition Not Implemented
description: UI shows "daily" repetition option for work blocks but backend doesn't actually implement repetition. Each pattern is saved only for the specific date with no logic to apply patterns to future dates. Need to implement repetition logic in database layer, add recurring pattern support (daily, weekly, etc.), and update UI to properly reflect repetition status.

title: ESLint Configuration Too Permissive
description: Current ESLint config doesn't catch potentially undefined values. No strict null checking rules enabled. TypeScript @typescript-eslint/recommended preset too lenient. This leads to bugs like sortedItems[0] access without safety checks. Need to enable strict-boolean-expressions and no-unsafe-member-access, then fix all resulting errors (likely 100+ locations).

title: Workflow/Task Model Confusion
description: Workflows stored as Tasks with hasSteps=true causing type confusion throughout codebase. Priority calculation creates fake Task objects from TaskSteps. Duplicate logic for handling tasks vs workflow steps. Constant type casting required. See context/architecture-improvements.md for proposed fix.

title: LogViewer Database Integration Missing
description: Cannot view historical logs from previous sessions. IPC handler for get-session-logs not implemented. Database query methods for ErrorLog table needed. Session selector UI disabled but ready. This blocks debugging of past issues. Need to add database methods to fetch ErrorLog entries by session and implement IPC handler in main process.

title: Scheduling Test Suite Rewrite Needed
description: Tests written for old deadline-scheduler don't match new SchedulingEngine behavior. Entire deadline-scheduling.test.ts suite skipped. One test in dependency-scheduling.test.ts skipped. Need to write new test suite for unified SchedulingEngine testing deadline pressure, async urgency, and priority calculations in context.

title: AI Amendment Dependency Editing Not Working
description: Dependency changes via voice commands fail. Issue discovered during beta test. Need to debug amendment-applicator.ts dependency logic. Voice amendments for dependencies not functional.

title: Script Directory Organization Issues
description: 1386+ ESLint warnings from scripts using console.log extensively. Consider unified CLI tool instead of 30+ individual scripts. Missing TypeScript types in some scripts. Duplicate functionality across scripts. Need to create unified CLI with subcommands and add proper .eslintrc for scripts directory.

title: Console Logging Cleanup Needed
description: Excessive logging in database operations (DB: logs everywhere), amendment parsing flow, and voice modal debugging. Noisy console output affecting development. Need to add debug flag or remove before production.

title: Test Coverage for Voice Features
description: Missing tests for voice amendment integration, workflow step addition, IPC enum serialization, and job context integration. Reduced confidence in voice features. Need comprehensive test suite for new functionality.

title: Workflow UI Polish Needed
description: Graph view could be more interactive. Step completion UI needs better feedback. Dependency visualization could be clearer. Overall UX improvements needed for workflow management.

title: Documentation Updates Needed
description: Architecture diagram still shows old dual model. API documentation for new voice features missing. Testing guide for voice amendments needed. Various documentation files need updates to reflect current state.

title: Performance Optimizations Needed
description: Database queries could be optimized. UI re-renders on amendment application. Voice recording file cleanup needed. Performance issues with large workflow handling.

title: Zoom buttons and scroll don't work
description: should be able to see multiple days by scrolling in the swim lanes, and should be able to scroll into the past. and the zoom should actually do somehting. But It shouldn't have a scrollbar, or if it does, horizontal scroll only. There should never be a vertical scroll bar.

title: Archive/Hide Completed workflows
description: Workflow cards take up a lot of space, and this space is wasted if they are completed and can't be hidden. We should allow the option to hide or archive tasks/workflows.

title: Gantt Chart Schedule summary should not include schedule editing by default
description: maybe we can collapse this, or entirely remove it. But it's too big compared to the timeline, which should be the main focus of attention.

title: Gantt Chart should default to 'now' whenever the 'Timeline' is clicked in the navigation
description: Gantt Chart should default to show 'now' on the timeline whenever the 'Timeline' is clicked in the navigation

title: When navigation sidebar is collapsed, icons should be clickable without tooltips
description: When navigation sidebar is collapsed, icons should be clickable without tooltips. Right now the tooltip looks weird and unprofessional, and sometimes I can't just click the icon itself to navigate, but have to hover to get the tooltip then click. very unintuitive.

title: Drag and drop edit capabilities for points on the scatter plot
description: Edit task and workflow step priorities (urgency and importance) by dragging them around on the scatter plot with an edit mode.

title: Delete strike system Markdown file from codebase
description: this got merged in a previous pr, but is weird and harsh and shouldn't exist.

title: Show timeline of all logged and planned future time
description: the timeline should be below the clock, or next to it, and should have blocks that are clickable to select the work logging session, where the user can then edit the start and end times. But it should be free of clutter, so the user can quickly go over how they spent their time for the day and change start and end times. The swim lanes are good for finding tasks under workflows to log time, and the clock is good for seeing that the time is continuous, but the clock is not big enough, and too crowded, especially for small work sessions and fine grained editing. If the clock was bigger and zoomable that could suffice too.

title: AI brainstorm should allow deletion of tasks and workflows
description: When editing results given by the AI, the user should be able to delete tasks, workflows, and workflow steps before regenerating the workflows/tasks with clarifications or before the User selects "Use edited results"

title: Should be able to 'start next task' from the home page.
description: The app should support the ability to start work from the home screen. What I mean by this is that the next scheduled task or the next scheduled workflow should be able to be started, meaning a work session that logs work should be attached to it, from multiple locations, including the task list page and the dual view work logger. Basically a user should be able to click start next task and then the next task according to scheduling priority, which accounts for all of the stuff that we use on the Gantt chart view, should be actively tracking work. We already show what task is actively tracking work in the dual work logger but it's kind of buggy. Here are a few of the things that I've noticed: first, when a workflow is started, we usually can complete the step that we are currently working on by pressing complete step on the progress tracking page. This doesn't stop the workflow in terms of progress tracking (like the start stop workflow button that also influences whether we see a current task being logged in the dual view work log) and it also doesn't start the next step of the workflow - instead it just shows that we are currently working on the workflow, but not a specific step of the workflow. Second, I think the current task is being worked on it stored in the browser, local storage or something, but it seems that if I close out the app and then restart it while working on a task, the actual work logging is broken and if I click on the dual view work log, I no longer see that I'm currently working on a task, but if I go back to the workflow page, I will still see that the start button has been pressed and that it is now a pause button and it appears as if I'm working on the workflow, but no time is being logged. So basically I just need to make sure that we can start and stop time on tasks and workflow, and that when the app is started or stopped and restarted, but if there is a currently tracked task, that it still is being tracked, and that on the door of your work longer, and on the task list page, we should have a button to start the next task which starts the next task in the priority order, determined by the scheduler

title: REST API for Claude Code workflow automation
description:
Create a REST API server in the main process that allows Claude Code to programmatically interact with the task planner app. This would include: 1) POST /api/workflows/{id}/advance - to advance workflow steps automatically, 2) GET /api/work-sessions/active - to see currently active work sessions, 3) GET /api/workflows/active - to see current workflows in progress, 4) GET /api/schedule/planned - to get planned schedules and upcoming tasks, 5) POST /api/tasks/{id}/start - to start working on a specific task, 6) POST /api/tasks/{id}/complete - to mark tasks as completed. This would enable Claude Code to help users manage their workflows more efficiently by automating routine task progression and providing better visibility into current work state without requiring manual app navigation.

Should also include integration through MCP. Claude code should never be able to use the api except through mcp protocols

title: Task List needs better refresh logic
description: Frequently, if I delete a task, or change a workflow or task, or add one, the task list view needs a refresh (command + r) in order to update. Maybe it's not listening to the proper events
steps: create a workflow, go to task page, observe workflow isnt there. refresh, observe task appears. Go to workflow pages, delete workflow. Go to task page, observe task display of workflow still remains. Refresh. Observer task disappears.

title: Need Feedback item for Start Next Task, plus work logging issue
description: We need to clean up our feedback submission form to make sure that all of the affected components that we have listed tied to actual files in the proper way. The main things I'm concerned about are the work status widget I'm not really sure exactly what this is, but I think it is the thing that shows today's plan capaci what work Block were currently in and how much focused and everything we've completed today but I'm not sure. And then also I'm not sure what the Gantt chart side bar is and why this is listed as it affected component. And then also I wanna make sure that the start next task widget has a feedback entry, but then as for the bug whenever start next task is clicked an hour of work is for some reason automatically logged on that task.
steps: Create a task or a workflow that can fit into a schedule block in your schedule and then click start next task button on the work status widget. Observe the message that appears that shows that one hour of work is logged and then click the log button on the top right of the screen to open the swim line view and observed that there is an hour of log time.
expected: Log time should only happen when we pause an active work session not when we start one

title: Show meetings on dual view clock
description: meetings should be displayed on the dual view clock alongside logged work sessions.

title: Swim lane rows cut off and no vertical scroll
description: can't see some tasks/workflow steps in the swim lane view because they don't fit on the page. Also, view is still buggy for sections of the swim lanes that the user must scroll to (initial view is fine, but if scroll to the right, the boxes and stuff are weird. Additionally. when a workflow is expanded into steps, the vertical ticks on the chart are misaligned with the regular tasks causing difficulty

title: Multiple work sessions running concurrently
description: If the app restarts or the currently active session that we are working on gets interrupted (like by quitting the app), when it restarts, we can have 2 sessions running concurrently (the current time we are working on is going to two different tasks!). If we were working on one when the app quit, we should resume it on startup. Only one should ever be allowed to be active anyway. And we should add tests that enforce this (try to mark 2 as active, observe error).
steps:
start work with start next task button or by clicking the start button on a task or workflow. 
quit the app
reopen the app.
observe that there is no session running (but if you are keen and open the swim lanes view, the time block for the most recently worked on session is still expanding)
start another work session
open swim lanes
wait a minute
observe two work sessions have expanded more than a minute
expected: only one session should be running at a time
actual: two or more sessions can have active time tracking, but only one is displayed.

title: Focus time completed today in sidebar navigation advances by 1 hour whenever a task is started
description: This should use the work tracking system everything else uses. Why is it even advancing by an hour in some weird hardcoded way? bizarre.

title: Expanding workflows into children causes bugs in rendering
description: I expanded a workflow into steps, and the two work sessions logged on it disappeared. I think we somehow started work on the overall workflow instead of a step somehow?

title: Refresh button on start next task should get the next available task
description:
User story: I am out at a coffee shop and I see the 'Start Next Task' widget tells me to do a task that I need to be at home for. I can't do this task at the moment, so I click the refresh icon. A new task pops up, different from the one previously shown. The task that pops up is the next up in priority order compared to the at-home task. 

Current behavior: the refresh supposedly refreshes the widget, but I don't think it does anything at all, which is why the functionality should change.

Key insights: the 'Start Next Task' priority order of tasks should be the SAME as the Gantt chart and any other scheduling. Everything should be using the same unified scheduling, same work blocks, etc. So this task should be as easy as maintaining an index into the list of tasks and workflows in scheduling order. Then clicking that refresh button would increment the index used to display the task. Then, whenever a task is completed or the app is restarted, the index should reset. This means that the refresh logic allowing us to work on different tasks (other than the one that is scheduled as 'up next') should only persist during an app session and should return to the default behavior of showing the next up by priority order whenever the app refreshes or restarts.

title: Tasks and workflows should be keyword searchable
description: Let's add a search field to both the workflows and task list views. These should allow keyword matching to titles, steps, or notes.
